images.path: images/Pocket Edition v0.3.0 alpha in game.png
images.alt_text: Pocket Edition v0.3.0 alpha in game

images.caption: The title screen of Pocket Edition a0.3.0j

texts.text: For a guide about all content in this release and the other releases of 0.3, see Bedrock Edition guides/0.3 releases.

v0.3.0 alpha was a major update to Minecraft: Pocket Edition that was released on April 24, 2012.[1][2] It added notable features, such as crafting, new mobs, blocks, items, and tools as well as other changes and fixes.[3]
v0.3.0 alpha was reuploaded on April 24, 2012 to fix a crash upon launch, and reuploaded again later that day to add more inventory space and a smaller GUI. It also fixed an icon bug.

1 Additions
1.1 Blocks
1.2 Items
1.3 Mobs
1.4 Gameplay
2 Changes
2.1 Blocks
2.2 Items
2.3 Non-mob entities
2.4 Gameplay
3 Internal version
4 J-version
5 References

Allows the player to craft a larger variety of blocks and items.
Can be crafted with wooden planks.

The half-height version of bricks.
Has a crafting recipe, but is not yet obtainable in Survival mode due to infinite stacks only counting as one of a material.

The brick variant of stairs.
Has a crafting recipe, but is not yet obtainable in Survival mode due to infinite stacks only counting as one of a material.

Used to craft yellow wool.
Can be crafted with dandelions.

Obtained by mining coal ore with a pickaxe.
Can be used to craft torches.

Obtained by mining lapis lazuli ore with a stone pickaxe.
Can be used to craft blue wool.

Bone meal
Cactus green
Charcoal
Can be used to craft torches.
Cocoa beans
Cyan dye
Gray dye
Ink sac
Light blue dye
Light gray dye
Lime dye
Magenta dye
Orange dye
Pink dye
Purple dye
Rose red

A common passive mob.
Does not drop anything when it dies.

A common passive mob.
Does not drop anything when it dies.

How the player make blocks and items.
Crafting menu can be accessed by either tapping the "Craft" button on the upper-left of the inventory, or by tapping on a crafting table.
Version exclusive: uses the Minecraft Advanced Touch Technology Interface System (MATTIS) crafting system.

Most tools, excluding shears, now have a limited number of uses based on their tier.
Wooden tools have 11 uses, and stone tools have 132 uses.
For most tools, breaking any block counts as 1 use.
For swords, this counts as 2 uses.
Hitting a mob currently counts as 0 uses.
Now drops coal when mined with any pickaxe.
Now drops itself when mined with a stone pickaxe.
Now drops 4–9 lapis lazuli when mined with a stone pickaxe.

Can now be crafted with snowballs.
Now drop snowballs when broken.
Now drop snowballs when destroyed with a shovel.
Now drops its item form when broken.

Are now used to craft bookshelves.
Can now be crafted with paper.
Can now be crafted with wooden planks.

Is now used to craft books.
Can now be crafted with sugar cane.
Can now be used to craft snow blocks.

Are now used to craft wooden and stone tools, ladders, torches, fences, and fence gates.
Can now be crafted with wooden planks.
Can now be crafted with sugar cane.
Wooden axes, pickaxes, shovels, and swords
Can now be crafted with wooden planks and sticks.
Are now obtainable via an inventory editor.

All items now need to be gathered, except shears, bricks, and glass.
The player no longer starts out with the following items in infinite stacks:
Stone shovel
Stone pickaxe
Stone axe
Stone sword
Ladder
Torch
Wooden door
Fence
Fence gate
Wooden planks
Wooden stairs
Cobblestone stairs
Stone slab
13 of the 16 colored wool blocks (excluding white, magenta, and orange)
Leaves
Bookshelves

Additions:
Brick stairs
Wooden slab
Brick slab
Orange wool
Magenta wool
Crafting table
The internal version is 0.3.0(3007), and has a size of 6.06 MB.
v0.3.0j alpha was released on Google Play on an unknown release date. The internal version is 0.3.0(3003), and has a size of 1.84 MB.
"Minecraft - Pocket Edition Now with Crafting!" (Archive) – mojang.com, April 24, 2012.
